enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 230-C. Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.
title: SCS CHEM 210-C-65 Organic Chemistry III

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will continue the study of common functional groups in organic chemistry. Topics include nomenclature, physical properties, characterization, and classic reaction types. Material will shift to strategies of synthesis using condensation, a-Substitution, and pericyclic reactions. Finally, applications in bioorganic and polymer chemistry will be explored.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Grade of C- or better in Chem 210-B and Chem 230-B; or by department permission.

Students registering for Chemistry 210-C must also enroll in the associated lab course, Chemistry 230-C.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students should be familiar with the nomenclature, properties, and reactivity of aldehydes, ketones, carboxylic acids, and carboxylic acid derivatives. Synthetic strategies should be mastered involving condensation reactions, a-substitution of carbonyls, and pericyclic reactions. Students should be able to apply this knowledge to modern areas of polymer and biomolecular chemistry. As the final organic chemistry course, students should be able to incorporate knowledge from previous sections to generate synthetic routes to simple organic compounds.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Organic Chemistry by L.G. Wade, 8th Edition, Pearson
Turning Technologies Model QT or NXT Response Device ("Clicker")

subject: CHEM
